ingredients.name: Aji (Horse Mackerel)
ingredients.note: (Sashimi Grade) can be replaced with other fish

ingredients.name: Tokyo Negi
ingredients.note: can be replaced with green onion

steps: Finely chop the Tokyo negi and ginger. First cut the fish into thin strips, then roughly chop.

steps.text: Once the fish is finely chopped, pound it with two knives to make it even finer. Once it's finely chopped, add green onions, ginger, and miso on top.
steps.note: If you only have one knife, use as many strikes as needed to make it finer.

steps: Mix the other ingredients into the fish, then pound again with a knife. Continue chopping thoroughly until smooth, mixing the ingredients together occasionally. Sprinkle over chopped Shiso and serve.

notes.title: Ochazuke Version
notes.text: Serving namerou over hot rice in Ochazuke is also a nice way to eat namerou. Adding white sesame and mixing everything together produces a great balance between the flavor of miso and sesame. This way of serving it is best served as a closing dish when drinking.
